stories.storyText: â€œThis is going to be sick bro!â€ your good friend Draymond says as you guys get ready. Your other friend Will, is going to be at yours by 8:30 pm. You guys get a bunch of food at the restaurant. Itâ€™s the Lâ€™Osteria restaurant in Bristol city centre, not far from the Apple store. You all finally leave the restaurant and youâ€™re headed for this mysterious â€œarcade barâ€. You have no idea whatsoever where this place is or what it's even about. Outside the arcade bar, there are bouncers. Will looks surprised as well. Then it hits you. This place is more than an arcade bar. Itâ€™s a club. You get a nod of approval from Draymond and Will. You immediately back away. Draymond is a little disappointed but there was no use. This ending is inevitable. Will isnâ€™t super happy either and he feels pretty bad because he invited you out for this in the first place. He then says: â€œI can drive you home if you likeâ€. Itâ€™s a nice offer but, do you want to ruin the night for Will or just make it home a lot easier and avoid an hour bus journey by 10 at night?

â€œAs you walk in through the door, immediately your eyes are met with a sea of bodies swaying to pulsating beats under the flickering neon lights. Each person was looking for their chance to shine. stories.btn1Text: Go find April and tell her

stories.storyText: You discreetly get up from your seat. You donâ€™t know where the bathroom is. And itâ€™s a pretty big club as well with multiple floors. So it could be anywhere. You then make your way up the stairs to the first floor which has an indoor balcony. You can see the entire club from up there including the lights, disco ball and the sea of people below. Youâ€™re almost stopped in your tracks by the beautiful sight. But you snap out of it and get back to the very important mission. Eventually you do spot her, on the other flight of stairs, close to the ground floor. And sheâ€™s already heading back to her seat. Without thinking about it, you race downstairs towards her table. Youâ€™ve got to stop this.

You race downstairs, pushing past people even on the staircase. You nearly tripped and fell, and tripped other people as well. As youâ€™re approaching the table, you can see April taking the glass towards her mouth, and in the most panicked state of all, you yell out: â€œApril stop! Donâ€™t drink that!â€

In the few seconds that follow, you just realise the consequences of your brash action. The whole club is staring at you, and people start whispering. Sheâ€™s beyond embarrassed. You realise that you need to make a justification for your action. Immediately. The guy himself looks trying to look confused and innocent. You obviously donâ€™t fall for his pretence. â€œI think she can drink whatever she wants mate,â€ he says, slowly making his way toward you. Then he turns to April and says â€œYou can drink it Aprilâ€. â€œDonâ€™t!â€ you shout again, even in your fearful state. â€œHe spiked itâ€. You make your way slowly to the guy, and in your bravest voice you say â€œUh, whyâ€™d you put something in her drink man?â€. At this point, you back away slowly, actually thinking about leaving. People are already looking and whispering. Then you hear a female voice from behind the guy. The same cute one you heard earlier. â€œIs everything okay?â€ you hear from behind the guy. April looks confused and a little scared. â€œDonâ€™t touch that drink April. He spiked it,â€ you say with a bold, convincing tone. â€œIs that true Liam?â€ April asks, her voice shaking a bit. â€œSo this jerkâ€™s name is Liam,â€ you think to yourself. Then Liam turns to April and says: â€œI donâ€™t know what this Donny is on about April.â€ Then turning his head back to you he says: â€œActually I was just telling him to get lostâ€. His eyes look like they are giving you a final warning. You know that if you leave, sheâ€™s going to have that drink and God knows whatâ€™s gonna happen to her afterwards. He takes a swing at you. You immediately dive to the ground.  Youâ€™re scared out of your mind. You honestly do not want this to end in a bar fight. But you stagger back up to your feet. â€œAnd I had to do my older brotherâ€™s laundry for a week! Unless he woulda got knocked outâ€.  April and I could not stop laughing. Draymond has the funniest stories from when he was a kid.
